Class KnightMove

  • java.lang.Object
    • KnightMove

  • public class KnightMove
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      KnightMove()
      Default constructor
      KnightMove(char[] columns, int[] rows)
      Initializes KnightMove object and adds moves to the linked list based on the contents of the char and int arrays which are passed in.
      KnightMove(int k)
      Initializes KnightMove object and makes the desired number of calls to randomMove()

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(KnightMove.Move m)
      Adds Move m to the end of the linked list
      KnightMove.Move getHead()
      Returns head of the linked list
      void grow()
      Increases size of linked list
      void printMoves()
      Prints all moves in linked list sequentially.
      KnightMove.Move randomMove()
      Makes a random valid move by calling getValidMoves() in the Move class, adds it to the end of the linked list, and returns it
      KnightMove.Move remove()
      Removes the last Move object from the linked list and returns it
      void shrink()
      Decreases size of linked list
      int size()
      Returns size of the linked list

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • KnightMove

        public KnightMove()
        Default constructor

      • KnightMove

        public KnightMove(int k)
        Initializes KnightMove object and makes the desired number of calls to randomMove()
        Parameters:
        k - the number of random moves to make

      • KnightMove

        public KnightMove(char[] columns,
                  int[] rows)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Initializes KnightMove object and adds moves to the linked list based on the contents of the char and int arrays which are passed in. Throws an exception if the user tries to make an invalid move
        Parameters:
        columns - an array of chars representing columns, to be processed sequentially
        rows - an array of ints representing rows, to be processed sequentially
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if user tries to make an invalid move

    • Method Detail

      • getHead

        public KnightMove.Move getHead()
        Returns head of the linked list
        Returns:
        head of the linked list

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns size of the linked list
        Returns:
        size of the linked list

      • grow

        public void grow()
        Increases size of linked list

      • shrink

        public void shrink()
        Decreases size of linked list

      • add

        public void add(KnightMove.Move m)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds Move m to the end of the linked list
        Parameters:
        m - any Move object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the added move is deemed invalid by the validMoveCheck() method within the Move class

      • remove

        public KnightMove.Move remove()
        Removes the last Move object from the linked list and returns it
        Returns:
        The last Move object in the linked list which has been removed

      • randomMove

        public KnightMove.Move randomMove()
        Makes a random valid move by calling getValidMoves() in the Move class, adds it to the end of the linked list, and returns it
        Returns:
        A random valid move that has been added to the end of the linked list

      • printMoves

        public void printMoves()
        Prints all moves in linked list sequentially. Informs the user if list is empty
